title: Understanding Radial Nodes
text: Radial nodes are regions where the probability of finding an electron is zero. They occur in spherical shells around the nucleus.

title: Formula for Radial Nodes
text: The number of radial nodes can be calculated using the formula: $$\(n-l-1\)$$, where \(n\) is the principal quantum number and \(l\) is the azimuthal quantum number.

title: Identify Quantum Numbers
text: For a 4s orbital, what are the values of \(n\) and \(l\)?

title: Calculate Radial Nodes
text: Using the formula $$\(n-l-1\)$$, calculate the number of radial nodes for a 4s orbital.
